Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034.model

Class Tile

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034.model.Tile
public class Tile
extends Object
Represents a single tile of the game board. Contains information on the state of the tile, such as workers, buildings and domes. Contains methods that allow tile state changes and methods regarding relative positions between tiles.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Tile​(Board board, int x, int y)
    Initializes a new tile with (x,y) coordinates.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      public Tile​(Board board, int x, int y)
      Initializes a new tile with (x,y) coordinates. At the moment of creation the tile has no worker (set to null), building (set to 0) nor dome (set to false). Starting tile (0,0) is the upper left one.
      Parameters:
      board - Reference to the game board, which contains all the tiles (in a given game).
      x - x coordinate of the new tile (left to right).
      y - y coordinate of the new tile (up to down).

  • Method Details

    • getWorker

      public Worker getWorker()

    • setWorker

      public void setWorker​(Worker newWorker)
      Set the worker standing in this tile to newWorker.
      Parameters:
      newWorker - Reference to the worker to be positioned in the tile
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If newWorker is null an exception is thrown. removeWorker should be used instead.

    • getBuilding

      public int getBuilding()

    • setBuilding

      public void setBuilding​(int height) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the height of the building on this tile.
      Parameters:
      height - the height of the building to set. height must be between 0 and 3
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If height is not between 0 and 3 the function throws an exception

    • hasDome

      public boolean hasDome()

    • setDome

      public void setDome​(boolean hasDome)

    • getX

      public int getX()

    • getY

      public int getY()

    • isNeighbouringTile

      public boolean isNeighbouringTile​(Tile tile)
      Checks if two tiles are neighbours (or the same).
      Parameters:
      tile - Reference to the tile to compare to.
      Returns:
      true only if the given tile is neighbour (or the same).

    • getNeighbouringTiles

      public ArrayList<Tile> getNeighbouringTiles()
      Finds neighbouring tiles, including the one the method is invoked on.
      Returns:
      List of references to every neighbouring tile.

    • getNextTileSameDirection

      public Tile getNextTileSameDirection​(Tile tile)
      Finds next tile in the same direction of the given one. Using this method requires that each needed check regarding the existence of the next tile has already been performed.
      Parameters:
      tile - Reference to the tile to be checked. Must be a neighbouring tile.
      Returns:
      Reference to the next tile in same direction
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the pre-condition is not met.

    • existsTileSameDirection

      public boolean existsTileSameDirection​(Tile tile)
      Checks if there is a valid tile next to the given one, in the same direction.
      Parameters:
      tile - Reference to the tile to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if it exists a neighbouring tile in the same direction, false otherwise.

    • validCoordinates

      public static boolean validCoordinates​(int x, int y)
      Checks if the given coordinates represent an existing tile
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are valid

    • isPerimeter

      public boolean isPerimeter()
      Checks if the selected tile is on the board perimeter.
      Returns:
      true if the tile is on the perimeter, false otherwise.

    • directionCalculator

      public Directions directionCalculator​(Tile tile)
      Calculates the relative direction between the tile it is invoked on and a given one.
      Parameters:
      tile - Destination tile, originating the direction.
      Returns:
      Relative direction between the two tiles.

    • neighbouringTileByDirection

      public Tile neighbouringTileByDirection​(Directions direction)
      Finds the reference to the tile on the given direction.
      Parameters:
      direction - Relative direction between the tile the method is invoked on and a destination tile.
      Returns:
      The destination tile on the given direction.
